dc.title: Statistical Insight
dc.subject.controlled: Industry Information, Economic & Statistical Resources, Country Information,  Information
dc.description: Statistical Insight provides fast and easy access to statistical information produced by U.S. Federal agencies, States, private organizations, and major intergovernmental organizations.

dc.title: ABI/Inform
dc.description: ABI/Inform Dateline- Contains complete articles from hundreds of local and regional publications that chronicle the day-to-day operations of thousands of U.S. and Canadian companies. Important business trends and events as well as regional market and economic conditions also receive considerable coverage. Coverage dates: 1985 ñ present                                                                                                          ABI/INFORM Global Direct- Periodical database specializing in business literature, including full text of over 1920 of the 2890 ABI/Inform titles. All titles are indexed and abstracted. Also included in ProQuest are Newspapers and General Periodicals. Coverage varies from 1971 - present                                                               ABI/INFORM Trade & Industry - Search more than 1200 business periodicals and newsletters with a trade or industry focus. Provides users with the latest industry news, product and competitive information,  trends, and a wide variety of other topics. Contains publications on every major industry, including finance, insurance, transportation, construction, and many more. Coverage dates: 1971 - present

dc.title: Access World News
dc.description: Full-text content of over 2,200 North American newspapers and more than 1,200 international newspapers, plus 300 wire services and over 200 broadcast news transcripts. Covers local, regional, and world issues, politics, government policies, sports, industries, cultural activities, schools, and the people and events in the community

dc.title: Accounting & Tax (ProQuest)
dc.description: Provides access to top accounting journals and trade publications, reference reports, proceedings, and dissertations, etc.

dc.title: Accunet AP Photo Archive
dc.description: The Accunet/AP Photo Archive contains approximately 700,000 photographs dating back to 1850; 800 additional images are added each day by photojournalists. Photographs of current events are available to view and print within minutes of an event. Also includes the International Photo Archive and a Euro/Asian Photo Archive

dc.title: African Development Indicators (World Bank Group)
dc.description: The most detailed collection of data on Africa, containing over 1,600 indicators, covering 53 African countries and spanning the period 1961 to 2008. Data include social, economic, financial, natural resources, infrastructure, governance, partnership, and environmental indicators. Data are drawn from World Development Indicators, and other sources.

dc.title: Alternative Press Index
dc.description: The Alternative Press Center (APC) is a non-profit collective dedicated to providing access to and increasing public awareness of the alternative press. Founded in 1969, it remains one of the oldest self-sustaining alternative media institutions in the United States. For more than a quarter of a century, the Alternative Press Index has been recognized as a leading guide to the alternative press in the United States and around the world.

dc.title: AmericanFactFinder (AFF)
dc.description:
is an online source for population, housing, economic and geographic data that presents the results from four key data programs: Decennial Census of Housing and Population - 1990 and 2000, Economic Census 1997 and 2002, American Community Survey - 1996-present, Population Estimates Program - July 1, 2003-present
Annual Review

dc.title: Annual Review
dc.description:
Since 1932, Annual Reviews has offered comprehensive, timely collections of critical reviews
written by leading scientists. Annual Reviews volumes are published each year for 40 focused
disciplines within the Biomedical, Life, Physical, and Social Sciences including Economics.

dc.title: Balance of Payments Statistics (IMF)
dc.description:
Provides information on the balance of payments among countries and geographical areas of the world. Contains approximately 100,000 time series covering more than 170 countries and areas and includes all series appearing on the BOP Country Pages.
Bernan Essential Government Information

dc.title: Bernan Essential Government Information
dc.description: Bernan is a leading distributor of essential publications from the United States government and intergovernmental organizations, and a respected publisher of critically acclaimed reference works based on government data.

dc.title: Bloomberg (Terminal located on the 5th Floor/Bobst Library)
dc.description: Online database providing current and historical financial quotes, business newswires, and descriptive information, research and statistics on over 52,000 companies worldwide.

dc.title: Business & Company Resource Center
dc.description: Business & Company Resource Center brings together a variety of global business information. Resources in the database include: Company profiles (including corporate parent/sibling relationships), Industry ranking, Products and brands, Stock prices, Investment reports, Industry statistics, Corporate chronologies and histories, Consumer  data, Emerging technology reports, Industry newsletter news and analysis, and Business journal news and analysis.

dc.title: Business Full Text
dc.description: Wilson Business Full Text is a full text database that indexes and abstracts articles from English-language periodicals published in the United States and elsewhere, including the leading business magazines and trade and research journals, plus the full text of selected periodicals. With Quality abstracting and indexing of more than 850 publications, users will find feature articles, product reviews, interviews, biographical sketches, corporate profiles, obituaries, surveys, book reviews, reports from associations, societies, trade shows and conferences, and more.

dc.title: Business Insights (formerly Reuters Business Insight)
dc.description: Market analysis reports across eight markets; eCommerce, Technology, Telecommunications, Financial Services, Healthcare, Consumer Goods, Energy and Human Resources.

dc.title: Business Monitor Online
dc.description: Provides extensive industry, economic, political, risk, and financial market analysis and data for about 175 countries. Especially useful for emerging economies.

dc.title: Capital IQ
dc.description:
(available to Stern MBA students on campus only! To access this database, eligible students should contact C. Norman (cnorman@stern.nyu.edu) to arrange a training session and get an account.)
Capital IQ Platform is a web and Excel-based research product that combines deep information on companies, markets, and people worldwide with robust tools for fundamental analysis, idea generation, and workflow management. Capital IQ Platform is deployed at over 2,700 leading investment banks, fund managers, private capital firms, and corporations.

dc.title: CCH Capital Changes Reports
dc.description: Capital Changes Reporter provides the facts and figures to compute a security holder's gain or loss from capital changes. Covers federal tax consequences of capital changes for more than 58,000 corporations and organizations resulting from stock dividends, stock splits, reorganizations, exchanges, rights and other changes in capital structure in a database that spans over 100 years.

dc.title: CCH Global ADR
dc.description: Capital Changes Reporter provides the facts and figures to compute a security holder's gain or loss from capital changes. Covers federal tax consequences of capital changes for more than 58,000 corporations and organizations resulting from stock dividends, stock splits, reorganizations, exchanges, rights and other changes in capital structure in a database that spans over 100 years.

dc.title: CCH Tax Library
dc.description: IntelliConnect is the next generation tool for researching CCH content. Picking up where Internet Research NetWork (IRN) left off, IntelliConnect is a robust system further enhanced by its ground breaking research capabilities and advanced customization tools. The quality of your research experience is greatly improved, as you can virtually design your own research sessions.

dc.title: CEIC Data Manager
dc.description: CEIC Data contains economic, industrial and financial time-series data and cover 117 countries and regions including detailed data on China. Data comes from analysts on the ground and the prime national and regional statistical agencies and major industrial data issuing organizations of each country covered.

dc.title: Cepr Discussion Papers
dc.description: Over 3000 Discussion Paper Abstracts are currently available online and all Discussion Papers published since the beginning of 1999 (i.e. from No2050) are available as electronic [PDF] files. Discussion papers may have been presented at conferences or workshops, but will not have been published in journals.

dc.title: China Data Online
dc.description: Covers comprehensive economic and statistical data on China such as data on county and city levels. It also provides economic and industrial census data from the 1982, 1990, 1995, and 2004 China Censuses. Additionally, it offers a series of unique China GIS data products with administrative boundaries of province, city, county and township.

dc.title: CIAO: Columbia International Affairs Online
dc.description: A wide range of scholarship that includes working papers from university research institutes, occasional papers series from NGOs, foundation-funded research projects, and proceedings from conferences.

dc.title: Columbia Digital Annual Reports
dc.description: In 2007 a project was undertaken to digitize a selection of corporate reports from the Columbia Business Library's extensive collection of historical corporate annual reports. The selection targeted corporations that operated in and around New York City.  Approximately 36 companies are represented with a total of approximately 770 individual reports (ca. 17,300 pages) ranging from the 1850s through the early 1960s.

dc.title: Compact Disclosure SEC 1992ñ1997 (Ask at 5th Floor/Bobst Library)
dc.description: This database contains extracts of the Securities and Exchange Commission filings from 12,000 public companies

dc.title: Compact Disclosure World Scope 1991ñ1997 (Ask at 5th Floor/Bobst Library)
dc.description: This database contains extracts of the Securities and Exchange Commission filings from 12,000 public companies.

dc.title: D & B Key Business Ratios
dc.description:
Using D&B's Financial Information Database, consisting of financial statements of U.S. corporations, partnerships, and proprietorships, you can calculate key business ratios that identify key relationships between financial data and allow you to monitor the state of your business.  
Key business ratios provide you with deeper insight as to the true meaning of the figures on your financial statements by comparing items rather than a direct reading of the financial figures. The 14 key business ratios cover all critical areas of business performanceósolvency , efficiency and profitability . They are broken down into median figures, with upper and lower quartiles, providing you with a more refined set of figures to work with. These ratios provide a profound and well-documented insight into all aspects for everyone involved in the financial workings of a businessóbusiness executives and managers, credit executives, bankers, lenders, investors, academicians and students.

dc.title: D & Bís Million Dollar Database
dc.description: The Million Dollar Database provides comprehensive  information on both public and private companies and their executives. Company profiles include specialty information like executive biographies and proprietary eight-digit SIC codes. The Million Dollar Database offers you unlimited searching, viewing and printing of detailed, location-specific company profiles with contact information

dc.title: Datastream (Terminal located on the 5th Floor/Bobst Library)
dc.description: Large database of statistical time series covering stocks, bonds, commodities and economic data for numerous countries, along with company profiles

dc.title: Direction of Trade Statistics (IMF)
dc.description: Provides figures on the value of merchandise exports and imports by trade partners as well as area and world aggregates showing trade flows between major areas of the world. DOTS provides access to monthly, quarterly and annual trade data from 1948 to 1999 for about 180 countries and geographic areas.

dc.title: Dissertation Abstracts
dc.description: With more than 2.4 million entries, the ProQuest Dissertations & Theses (PQDT) database is the most comprehensive collection of dissertations and theses in the world. UMI offers over 2 million titles for purchase in microfilm or paper formats. More than 930,000 are available in PDF format for immediate free download, and an average of 2,000 new PDFs are added to the database each week.

dc.title: Doing Business Database
dc.description: The Doing Business Project provides objective measures of business regulations and their enforcement across 183 economies and selected cities at the subnational and regional level. Doing Business offers detailed subnational reports, which exhaustively cover business regulation and reform in different cities and regions within a nation. These reports provide data on the ease of doing business, rank each location, and recommend reforms to improve performance in each of the indicator areas

dc.title: Ebsco Business Source Premier
dc.description: Full text for over 2,470 scholarly business journals covering management, economics, finance, accounting, international business and much more.

dc.title: Econ Lit
dc.description: Comprehensive, indexed bibliography of worldwide literature on economics from over 300 major economics journals, books, and collected volumes. Coverage: 1969-present ; Updates: Quarterly

dc.title: Economist Historical Archive
dc.description: The Economist Historical Archive delivers a complete searchable copy of every issue of The Economist from 1843 to 2006. New full-colour images, multiple search indexes, exportable financial tables and a gallery of front covers highlighting a key topic of each week - all combine to offer a primary source of research covering the 19th and 20th centuries.

dc.title: EIU City Data
dc.description: Includes Country Reports, Country Monitor, Country Forecast, and Country Commerce as well regional newsletters, and a time series database providing information and data on over 190 countries. Information is presented as analysis, briefings, commentary, or forecasts.

dc.title: EIU Country Commerce
dc.description:
Country Commerce is a practical reference guide to the specific operating conditions, commercial laws and business regulations in 55 countries. It offers unbiased guidance on critical issues such as obtaining proper permits and registrations, protecting your intellectual property in the Internet age and complying with local tax laws-including e-commerce rules. Update frequency: Annually
EIU Country Data

dc.title: EIU Country Data
dc.description: Analytical database of worldwide economic indicators and forecasts, covering more than 270 statistical variables in series for each of 115 countries. Data can be manipulated, displayed, graphed, analyzed and downloaded in various formats. Major data categories include economic structure, foreign payments, external debt stock, external debt service, external trade, trends in foreign trade, quarterly indicators.

dc.title: EIU Country Finance
dc.description: Comprehensive guide to changes in financial services, operating conditions, tax laws and investment opportunities in the world's 45 principal financial markets. Topics covered in each report include cash management and short-term investment options; bank and non-bank credit; equity and debt financing; and markets for stocks, bonds, currencies and derivatives. Update frequency: Annually

dc.title: EIU Country Forecast
dc.description:
Focus on the key issues affecting a country's political and economic outlook and its business environment over the next five years. Each report gives you access to a comprehensive, coherent and integrated set of political, economic and business forecasts, continuously updated and written from the point of view of foreign investors. Update frequency: Monthly
EIU Country Profiles

dc.title: EIU Country Profiles
dc.description: Outline a country's economic and political status and background. Country Profiles put an annual perspective on the long-term political and social issues affecting each country, providing a complete introduction to all international markets.

dc.title: EIU Country Reports
dc.description: Measure the political, economic policy, economic structure and liquidity risk of activities in 100 emerging markets over a two-year forecasting horizon. Each report provides crucial insight into the risk of investing in the currency, sovereign debt or banking sector of an emerging market. Update frequency: Monthly

dc.title: EIU European Policy Analyst
dc.description: Concise, practical guide to the complex EU regulatory environment. It monitors how new EU policies, regulations and judgements will affect business interests in the single market. Each issue reviews all the new single-market regulations and directives; assesses recent competition policy decisions; examines EU environmental policy and relations with the EU's main external trading partners; provides commentary on topical issues; and forecasts expected developments in the coming year. Update frequency: Quarterly

dc.title: EIU Market Indicators & Forecasts
dc.description: A powerful and comprehensive database of industries, demographics, consumption, average wages, income levels, market size, infrastructure and the business environment data on 60 key countries worldwide. Contains over 500 series stretching back to 1990 and forward five years. Update frequency: Monthly

dc.title: EIU World Investment Service
dc.description: Customisable country reports to support overseas investment decisions. The service covers the world's 60 largest economies and provides detailed data and analysis on the political and economic background, the business environment, business costs, foreign investment regulations, trends in foreign investment. Plus a detailed database containing flows of investment and mergers & acquisitions by country and by industry. Update frequency: Daily

dc.title: eMarketer
dc.description: eMarketer gathers data from more than 4,000 sources worldwide including research firms, consultancies, corporations, universities, trade organizations, private foundations, and government and nonprofit agencies.

dc.title: Ethnic Newswatch
dc.description: Features newspapers, magazines, and journals of the ethnic and minority press, providing researchers access to essential, often overlooked perspectives. With titles dating from 1990, ENW presents a comprehensive, full-text collection of more than 1.8 million articles from more than 315 publications offering both national and regional coverage.

dc.title: Europa World Yearbook
dc.description: First published in 1926, the year book is renowned as one of the world's leading reference works, covering political and economic information in more than 250 countries and territories

dc.title: Eurostat Statistics
dc.description: Its task is to provide the European Union with statistics at European level that enable comparisons between countries and regions.

dc.title: Factiva (formerly Dow Jones Interactive)
dc.description: Full-text database providing timely and detailed facts, figures and analyses of companies, industries and financial markets. Includes industry and trade publications, news sources, and company and market data. Coverage varies by source.

dc.title: First Research
dc.description: Industry profiles which include industry overview, recent developments, business challenges, trends and opportunities, executive insight, call preparation questions, financial information, industry ratio's, industry forecast and rating, web links and acronyms

dc.title: Foundation Directory Online
dc.description: Foundation Directory provides descriptions of grant makers, including private grant-making foundations, community foundations, operating foundations, and corporate grant makers.

dc.title: Gartner Reports
dc.description: In depth market research reports on information technology. Topic areas include: computing hardware, software infrastructure, IT services, communications, semiconductors and business objectives.

dc.title: Global Development Finance
dc.description: Global Development Finance Online (GDF) provides data on more than 200 external debt and financial flow indicators for the 134 countries that report public and publicly-guaranteed debt to the World Bank Debtor Reporting System. The time series data run from 1970 to 2016, where available.

dc.title: Global Financial Database
dc.description: Global Financial Data contains historical financial and economic data on 200 countries. Data includes:long-term historical indices on stock markets; total teturn data on stocks, bonds, and bills; interest rates; exchange rates; inflation rates; bond indices; commodity indices and prices.

dc.title: Global Insight
dc.description: Global Insight contains time series, economic, and business data for the United States and international economies. Data is available for downloading into a spreadsheet. Includes Data Insight (Economic and Financial Data) and Country Intelligence.

dc.title: Global Market Information Database
dc.description: GMID contains over a million demographic, economic and  statistics for 205 countries worldwide. The database also contains 6-year historic market size data for more than 330 consumer products in 52 countries, plus 5-year forecasts. Coverage: 1977 to present, forecasts to 2016.

dc.title: Global Newsbank
dc.description: A fully searchable collection of historical newspapers from around the globe. This uniquely comprehensive online resource was created in partnership with the Center for Research Libraries - one of the world's largest and most important newspaper repositories.

dc.title: Goldsmiths' Kress Library of Economic Literature (The Making of the Modern World)
dc.description:
Primary Source Microfilm's Goldsmiths'-Kress Library of Economic Literature is the single most comprehensive and valuable collection in existence for researching the literature of economics and business dating from the last half of the 15th century to the early 20th century.
The collection combines two pre-eminent collections--the Goldsmiths' Library of Economic Literature at the University of London, England and the Kress Library of Business and Economics at the Harvard University Graduate School of Business Administration.

dc.title: Guidestar (nonprofit organizations)
dc.description: Information on more than 40,000 public charities. GuideStar Analyst Reports include data on revenue and expenses and a balance sheet.

dc.title: Historical Statistics of the United States
dc.description: This definitive reference work contains more than 37,000 annual time series of quantitative historical information covering virtually every quantifiable dimension of American history: population, work and welfare, economic structure and performance, governance, and international relations.

dc.title: Hooverís Online
dc.description: Find information on 40,000 companies covered by Hoover's. Company Capsules and Profiles deliver information on a company's location, summary financials, top competitors, top officers, and more. Use the title or company field to search company names.

dc.title: IBISWorld
dc.description: A comprehensive collection of industry market research.

dc.title: IndiaStat
dc.description: Access to statistics on health, higher education, agricultural and industrial production information, economic statistics, and tourism related data in India. The database also contains information bank and financial institutions, companies, co-operatives, crime and law, population, foreign trade, labour and workforce, housing, media, power, transport, urban-rural settlements and economy in India and more.

dc.title: Infoshare Online
dc.description: Database of statistics about New York City from 1980 to the present. Consists of Official statistical data from U.S., New York State, and New York City agencies. Includes population statistics, immigration trends, socio-economic indicators, birth and death data, hospitalizations, and more.

dc.title: Institutional Investor Journals
dc.description: Institutional Investor, Inc.'s Journals are quarterly publications offering in-depth, original and practical research in global investment and finance with an extensive online archive.

dc.title: International Financial Statistics Online (from the IMF)
dc.description: The IFS database contains approximately 32,000 time series covering more than 200 countries and areas and includes all series appearing on the IFS Country Pages; exchange rate series for all Fund member countries, plus Aruba and the Netherlands Antilles; major Fund accounts series; and most other world, area, and country series from the IFS World Tables.

dc.title: International Million Dollar Directory
dc.description: D&B's global database of more than 60 million global companies covers the spectrum from new start-up companies to small businesses (less than eight employees) to minority and women-owned companies to the "blue chip" companies worldwide.

dc.title: International Political Science Abstracts
dc.description: Indexes and abstracts articles from periodicals published throughout the world in the area of political science. Dates of coverage: 1989-2010

dc.title: Investext (now part of Thomson Research)
dc.description: -- ONLY WORKS WITH INTERNET EXPLORER! -- To access Investext click on the "Research" tab. Search investment analyst's reports on companies & industries from over 500 brokers in North America, Europe, Asia/Pacific, Latin America, Africa and the Middle East. Search by company, industry, or keyword.

dc.title: ISI Emerging Markets
dc.subject.controlled: Company & Financial Information, Economic & Statistical Resources
dc.description: Full-text news, financial and economic information on emerging market countries.

dc.title: Islamic Finance Information Service (IFIS)
dc.description: IFIS is the first subscription-based electronic information service focusing on the Islamic financial industry.

dc.title: JSTOR
dc.description: Full-text articles from more than 600 scholarly journals in several disciplines

dc.title: Kluwer Online
dc.description: SpringerLink is an integrated full-text database for journals, books, protocols, eReferences, and book series published by Springer. SpringerLink currently offers 2,567 fully peer-reviewed journals and 42,700 books online.

dc.title: Lexis-Nexis Academic Universe
dc.description: Full-text database of over 6000 sources including newspapers, journals, wire services, newsletters, SEC filings and international company reports, case law, government documents, transcripts of broadcasts, and selected reference works.

dc.title: Market Research Monitor: Euromonitor Journals
dc.description: This database interface integrates the content of Market Research Monitor and World Lifestyles. Passport interface includes a 7 year archive of more than 850 consumer and retail reports plus 600 major market profiles. Access to up-to-date global consumer market research, trends, market background, market forecasts, analysis and market size data, forecasts, and market shares. International and U.S. coverage.

dc.title: MarketResearch.com Academic
dc.description: Full-text service of market research reports on many topics. Includes more than 40,000 market intelligence publications from 350 publishers worldwide.

dc.title: Mergent Bond Viewer
dc.subject.controlled: Economic & Statistical Resources, Company & Financial Information,
dc.description: Mergent's BondViewer is the financial industry's latest solution for US taxable and municipal fixed income and evaluation data.  From pre-sale through defeasance, count on Mergent to provide you on-demand access to a wide-range of bond data including both issuer and bond level terms and condition data, US taxable bonds, municipal bonds and retail notes.

dc.title: Mergent Online
dc.description: Information on more than 21,000 US and international companies, including 10,000 NYSE, AMEX and Nasdaq exchange companies. All SEC (EDGAR) filings and domestic and international annual reports are included.

dc.title: Mergent Web Reports (Corporate Manuals)
dc.description: Mergent Web Reports is an online database offering a vast archive of corporate annual, quarterly and interim reports from over 100 countries.

dc.title: Meridian Online
dc.description: Meridian Online is a rich and comprehensive source of historical and current data, performance measures, and relevant information from over 40 leading stock exchanges around the world. In addition to exchange-level data, the service provides coverage of over 850 industry sectors and market indices.

dc.title: Mintel Reports
dc.description: Covering market size, market share, trends, and forecast data for thousands of consumer goods categories worldwide.

dc.title: Morningstar
dc.description: Access Morningstar financial reports, screening, analyst reports and portfolio screening.

dc.title: National Academy Press
dc.description: The National Academies Press (NAP) was created by the National Academies to publish the reports issued by the National Academy of Sciences, the National Academy of Engineering, the Institute of Medicine, and the National Research Council, all operating under a charter granted by the Congress of the United States. The NAP publishes more than 200 books a year on a wide range of topics in science, engineering, and health, capturing the most authoritative views on important issues in science and health policy. The institutions represented by the NAP are unique in that they attract the nation's leading experts in every field to serve on their award-winning panels and committees. This is the right place for definitive information on everything from space science to animal nutrition.

dc.title: NBER Working Paper Series
dc.description: Contains the full-text of working papers from the National Bureau of Economics Research. The NBER covers four areas of empirical research: developing new statistical measurements, estimating quantitative models of economic behavior, assessing the effects of public policies on the U.S. economy, and projecting the effects of alternative policyproposals. Many of its publications, including its working papers, NBER reporter, and NBER digest, are available for download.

dc.title: New Palgrave Dictionary of Economics Online
dc.description:
R. H. Inglis Palgrave's original Dictionary of Political Economy (1894ñ9), was a landmark in both publishing and economics, a liberal and scholarly overview of the whole sphere of economic thought in its day. Henry Higgs's revised edition, Palgrave's Dictionary of Political Economy (1923ñ6), retained the spirit of the original while embracing new concepts in the development of economics as a discipline.
From 2010 the New Palgrave Dictionary of Economics Online includes all 1,919 articles from the first edition of The New Palgrave, publishing in 1987.

dc.title: New York Times Historical
dc.description: The Historical New York Times (1851-2007) with Index (1851-1993) provides search capability using subject terms and topics for focused and targeted results in combination with searchable full text, full page, and article-level images from the Historical New York Times (1851-2006).

dc.title: New York Times via Proquest
dc.description: Full-text articles from The New York Times.

dc.title: New York Times: 1980ñpresent via Lexis-Nexis
dc.description: Full-text articles from The New York Times.

dc.title: PAIS
dc.description: Contains citations to periodical articles, books, government documents and research reports in business, finance, government, international relations, banking, environment, health, social sciences, political science, law, and legislations. It is international and multilingual. Many items contain abstracts. Coverage: most recent ten years; updates: monthly

dc.title: Political Risk Yearbook
dc.description: Since 1979, PRS has consistently focused on political and country risk analysis, using two separate approaches to monitor countries, Political Risk Services and International Country Risk Guide.

dc.title: PressDisplay
dc.description: Library PressDisplay provides access to today's newspapers from around the world in full-color, full-page format.  The collection currently includes over 1,000 U.S. and international titles.

dc.title: Project Muse
dc.description: Project Muse is a full-text database of the recent issues of approximately two hundred journals in the humanities, social sciences, and mathematics from thirty scholarly publishers.

dc.title: PROMT
dc.description: Magazine and newspaper index for companies and industries focusing on markets and products around the world.

dc.title: Proquest
dc.description: An interdisciplinary database covering more than 2,000 professional, scholarly, trade and general interest periodicals, including full-text for over a thousand titles and indexing/abstracts for the others. The database also covers 27 primary and secondary US newspapers (including a 90-day rolling file of The New York Times), 11 of which are in full-text. ProQuest Direct represents titles found in ABI-INFORM (Global Edition), Periodicals Abstracts (Research II Edition), and Newspaper Abstracts. Coverage: varies ; Updates: Daily

dc.title: Proquest Historical Annual Reports
dc.description: Over 800 companies' annual reports (1844-current) available through searchable pdf images. The collection includes digital reproductions of over  1.3 million pages found in more than 43,000 reports. Key data (financial, Fortune 500 ranking, industry classification, key people, geographic location, auditor, and related companies) are indexed in the citation and can be searched. Reports can be browsed by company name, industry or date. Cross-searchable to other historical periodical databases.

dc.title: PRS CountryData
dc.description: Sources of data are International Country Risk Guide and Political Risk Services. Political Risk Services have 100 Country Reports that monitor the risks to international business over the next five years, using the tried and true Coplin-O'Leary methodology. International Country Risk Guide publications monitor 150 countries, rating a wide range of risks facing international business & financial institutions with its unique methodology.

dc.title: PsychInfo via CSA
dc.description: Indexes literature from an array of disciplines related to psychology such as psychiatry, education, business, medicine, nursing, pharmacology, law, linguistics, and social work.

dc.title: PsychInfo via Ovid
dc.description: Indexes literature from an array of disciplines related to psychology such as psychiatry, education, business, medicine, nursing, pharmacology, law, linguistics, and social work.

dc.title: Red Books
dc.description:
**If prompted to log-in click on "Site Access" link below the log-in box.** 
The Advertising Red Books can be used to identify agency clients, locate just the need-to-know information about agency clients, reveal the right contacts at those clients for prospecting, find a company by searching by the brand it owns, to check-out the competition, and much more.
Primarily used as a lead generation (e.g. to download  lists) and competitive intelligence tool, The Advertising Red Books has the advantage of being part of LexisNexis and Reed Elsevier

dc.title: Roubini Global Economics (was RGE Monitor)
dc.description: RGE aggregates information on many global economic and geostrategic issues.

dc.title: Science Direct
dc.description: ScienceDirect's extensive and unique full text database covers authoritative titles from the core scientific literature, including high-impact factor titles such as THE LANCET, Cell and Tetrahedron.

dc.title: SimplyMap
dc.description: Simply Map includes thousands of demographic, business, and  data variables.

dc.title: Social Science Research Network (SSRN)
dc.description: Social Science Research Network (SSRN) is composed of a number of specialized research networks in the social sciences. Topics covered by networks include accounting, economics, financial economics, legal scholarship, and management (including negotiation and ). The SSRN eLibrary consists of abstracts of scholarly working papers and forthcoming papers and an electronic paper collection of downloadable full text documents in pdf format.

dc.title: Social Sciences Citation Index
dc.description: The Social Sciences Citation Index is a multidisciplinary index to the journal literature of the social sciences. It fully indexes over 1,950 journals across 50 social sciences disciplines. It also indexes individually selected, relevant items from over 3,300 of the world's leading scientific and technical journals.

dc.title: Sociological Abstracts
dc.description: Sociological Abstracts indexes the world's literature in theoretical and applied sociology and related disciplines in the social and behavioral sciences from over 1,700 journals, selected books, conference reports, case studies, and dissertations ). Abstracts are included for journal articles and books.

dc.title: SourceOECD
dc.description: SourceOECD is the online library of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development. This library comprises 20 book collections by theme, containing all of the OECD monographs and reports, 24 periodicals, a reference title, and the OECD statistical databases.

dc.title: Sport Business Research Network
dc.description: Full-text database focusing on the sporting goods and sports  industry. Provides market research and industry news on all aspects of the industry including sports equipment sales, sports participation, sports broadcasting, sports sponsorship and sports . Coverage: 1996 to the present, updated daily.

dc.title: Springer LINK
dc.description: SpringerLink is an integrated full-text database for journals, books, protocols, eReferences, and book series published by Springer. SpringerLink currently offers 2,567 fully peer-reviewed journals and 42,745 books online.

dc.title: SRDS Media Solutions
dc.description: SRDS delivers up-to-date consumer demographics, lifestyle analysis reports, and regional market profiles.

dc.title: SRDS Media Source
dc.description: SRDS delivers up-to-date media information, including detailed advertising rates, deadline dates and contact data for the print and broadcast.

dc.title: Standard & Poor's NetAdvantage
dc.description: Contains Computstat stock reports, S&P Tear Sheet Reports, Global Industry Surveys and data on mutual funds. Updated annually.

dc.title: TableBase
dc.description: TableBase is a database comprised of tabular information of a strategic nature. Every record has a unique table title written by our editorial staff which aids users in making precise selection of tables that meet their searching needs. Many of the table records also have textual content which supports the data in the tables.  The tables provide information such as: market share, market size, capacity, production, imports, exports, sales, product and brand rankings, forecasts, healthcare statistics and demographics.

dc.title: The Complete World Development Online
dc.description: Here you will find every page of every World Development Report published by the World Bank since the first report was released in 1978.

dc.title: Thomson Research
dc.description: Thomson Research contains real-time and historical SEC EDGAR filings, scanned images of company annual reports and foreign exchange filings.

dc.title: UN Commodity Trade Statistics Database
dc.description: UN Commodity Trade Statistics Database (UN Comtrade) contains trade data (imports, exports and re-exports) from countries world-wide. For each country annual data can be retrieved by commodity and trading partner. Commodity is defined by either standard international product codes or international industry codes.

dc.title: UNdata
dc.description: More than 450 statistical time series for countries from around the world covering a wide range of economic and socio-demographic topics. Descriptions of the international sources and definitions used in compiling the data are included.

dc.title: Universal Database of Russian Newspapers
dc.description: The Universal Database of Russian Newspapers (UDB-COM) provides comprehensive coverage of national news, current events, economic developments and cultural events in Russia. Official sources, independent media and partisan publications are all represented on this database, thus offering a wide array of opinions and perspectives. Several English-language newspapers including the notable Moscow Times, widely read by the international community in the Russian capital, constitute an important part of the database.

dc.title: ValueLine Research Center
dc.description: Click the "Log In" box in the upper right hand to access ValueLine. Contains issues from the current year of the investment survey and small and mid-cap edition, covering stocks, mutual funds, options and convertible securities as well as special situation stocks.

dc.title: Wall Street Journal via Proquest
dc.description: The digital backfile of the Wall Street Journal provides historical coverage of business news and worldwide financial markets. Part of ProQuest Historical Newspapers, this database delivers cover-to-cover full-images in PDF and searchable ASCII text.

dc.title: Wharton Research Database Service (WRDS)
dc.subject.controlled: Economic & Statistical Resources, Industry Information, Company & Financial Information
dc.description: You must request an account. New York University faculty, administrators, staff, and PhD students are allowed to have a WRDS account.WRDS provides access to important databases in the fields of finance, accounting, banking, economics, management,  and public policy including Compustat, CRSP, Global Insight and OptionMetrics.

dc.title: Wilson Omni
dc.description: Provides indexing and abstracting of articles from over 800 English-language business magazines, trade and research journals, plus the full text of selected periodicals.

dc.title: World Bank Country Profiles
dc.description: The World Bank is a vital source of financial and technical assistance to developing countries around the world. Our mission is to fight poverty with passion and professionalism for lasting results and to help people help themselves and their environment by providing resources, sharing knowledge, building capacity and forging partnerships in the public and private sectors.

dc.title: World Bank e-Library
dc.description: The World Bank e-library is an online, fully cross-searchable portal of over 5,000 World Bank documents. The collection consists of over 2,000 World Bank publications and over 3,200 Policy Research Working Papers, plus each new book and paper as they are published. Searchable by region and topic; documents available as downloadable PDFs.

dc.title: World Development Indicators
dc.description: WDI Online is a comprehensive database on development data covering 575 indicators, 225 countries, and 18 regional and income groups. The extensive collection of development data includes population, income, social, economic, financial, natural resources, and environmental indicators for more than forty years (1960 to 2000, where data are available).

dc.title: WorldCat (OCLC)
dc.description: WorldCat is the world's largest network of library content and services. Search for popular books, music CDs , videos and many new kinds of digital content, such as downloadable audiobooks. You may also find article citations with links to their full text; authoritative research materials, such as documents and photos of local or historic significance; and digital versions of rare items that aren't available to the public.  Because WorldCat libraries serve diverse communities in dozens of countries, resources are available in many languages.
